content.description: The graph above shows <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> measurements taken from Mauna Loa, Hawaii, and the Vostok ice core, which was drilled from ice sheets in Antarctica.
content.question: Which of the following hypotheses is best supported by the graph?

choices.label: Temperatures were much colder 125,000 years ago than the average temperature over the past 400,000 years.
Temperatures were the same 125,000 years ago as they are today.
Temperatures were warmer 125,000 years ago than the average temperature over the past 400,000 years.
Temperatures were cooling at a rate 125,000 years ago that was unprecedented compared to the rate over the past 400,000 years.

content.answer: Temperatures were warmer 125,000 years ago than the average temperature over the past 400,000 years.

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Interpret experimental data and results in relation to a given hypothesis.
